definition: truth to tell/to be quite honest...
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
to conceal from/to keep (sb) in the dark

sentences.english: I haven't written because I have been so depressed.
sentences.chinese: 實不相瞞，一直沒回信的原因是，我情緒低落。

sentences.english: To be honest, I haven't written because I have been so depressed.
sentences.chinese: 實不相瞞，一直沒回信的原因是，我情緒低落。

sentences.english: To tell the truth, I really feel jealous｜of those young lovers.
sentences.chinese: 實不相瞞，我很嫉妒那些年輕情侶。

sentences.english: To tell the truth, the angel is my little nephew.
sentences.chinese: 實不相瞞，那個天使是我的小外甥。

definition: lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
indirect, psychological method of getting sb to do as one wishes (e.g. questioning whether they are up to the task)
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
to make a long story short (idiom)
to go through water and tread on fire (idiom); not afraid of any difficulty
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
